Name: Stithians Reservoir
Risk: Blue-green algae, geosmin, ammonium, colour, DOC, turbidity

Name: Burrator Reservoir
Team: Dave, Donna, Josie, Naomi and Pia
Research_Q1: Identify any significant spatial sources of DOC.
Research_Q2: Identify any significant temporal drivers of DOC.
Research_Q3: Identify significant flow inputs within the Devonport Leat and River Meavy.
Research_Q4: Monitor the impact of habitat restoration and management on DOC concentrations in the Devonport Leat and River Meavy.
Research_Q5: Monitor the impact of habitat restoration and management on flow within the Devonport Leat and River Meavy.
WP_1: Use historic spot sample and climatic data to identify significant temporally-variable climatic drivers of DOC - GAM analysis.
WP_2: Use historic and spatial data to build an understanding of potential sources/risk areas for DOC within the catchment - Risk mapping.
WP_3: Collection and lab analysis of water quality and hydrometric data.
WP_4: Analyse our new data to build on our understanding of DOC sources within the catchment, and identify any significant changes following restoration work - source apportionment and change detection.
WP_5: General play with our data, including curve offsetting algae/DOC sondes.
WP_6: Contribute to the design of the peatland restoration plan and catchment management measures.

Name: Colliford Lake

Name: Avon Dam Reservoir
Team: Dave, Emilie, Josie, Naomi and Pia
Research_Q1: Identify any significant spatial sources of geosmin.
Research_Q2: Identify any significant temporal drivers of elevated geosmin levels.
Research_Q3: Identify any significant spatial sources of MIB levels.
Research_Q4: Identify any significant temporal drivers of MIB levels.
WP_1: Use historic spot sample and climatic data to identify significant temporally-variable climatic drivers of geosmin and MIB - GAM analysis.
WP_2: Use historic spot sample data to identify temporal relationships between water quality parameters - Curve off-setting analysis.
WP_3: Use historic and spatial data to build an understanding of potential sources/risk areas for geosmin/MIB within the catchment - Risk mapping.
WP_4: Collection and lab analysis of water quality, RGB and hydrometric data, including autosampler data when geosmin analysis comes online).
WP_5: Analyse our new data to build on our understanding of geosmin/MIB sources within the catchment - Source apportionment.
WP_6: Analyse our new data in combination with SWW WTW data to build an understanding of spatio-temporal drivers of geosmin/MIB.
